question: Who was the chairman of National Knowledge Commission?
explanation: National Knowledge Commission is an eight memembered committee established by Dr. Manmohan Singh in 2005. The purpose of this committee is to bring reforms in education sector by adapting and upgrading to latest technologies. The Chairman of this committee was Sam Pitroda. National Knowledge Commission Report was released on 2006. E-governance and National Portal of India was established in India was established in India based on the recommendations of NKC.
